p: To examine the genotype of VZV, 6 ORFs (ORFs 1, 21, 22, 50, 54 and 68) of the VZV genome were amplified (Supplementary Fig. S 2D) [ 11, 13, 16], and phylogenetic analysis indicated that the genotypes of VZV in the trunk and head were genotype J (clade 2) (Fig. 2a). The SNP variations in 5 ORFs (ORFs 1, 21, 22, 50 and 54) were determined. A total of 13 SNP variations were found, and the synonymous mutations also confirmed that VZV in the trunk and head were genotype J (Fig. 2b). To assess this VZV whether a VZV glycoprotein E (gE) mutant virus (VZV-MSP), ORF68 (gE) was amplified. A synonymous G > A mutation in codon 150 of ORF68 (SNP 116255) did not occur (Fig. 2b); this result confirmed that VZV in the trunk and head was not a VZV-MSP mutant virus.
